body_html:
@qlzh727 thanks for taking a look. I observed the GPU/CPU behavior difference in a comment above. Allow me to summarize what's already in this thread:

  1. this issue has been present since at least TF 1.5 and has been repro'd now on 1.8, 1.9, and tf-nightly-gpu.
  2. this issue only occurs when executing on GPU; using a CPU build or running with no GPU devices succeeds.
  3. this issue only occurs when TIME_STEPS is >= 32.

My suspicion is that there's a synchronization issue in the GPU code path. Consider different values of parallel_iterations on dynamic_decode.

My suspicion is that there's a synchronization issue in the GPU code path. Consider different values of parallel_iterations on dynamic_decode.
body:
@qlzh727 thanks for taking a look. I observed the GPU/CPU behavior difference in a comment above. Allow me to summarize what's already in this thread:

1) this issue has been present since at least TF 1.5 and has been repro'd now on 1.8, 1.9, and tf-nightly-gpu.
2) this issue only occurs when executing on GPU; using a CPU build or running with no GPU devices succeeds.
3) this issue only occurs when `TIME_STEPS` is >= 32.

My suspicion is that there's a synchronization issue in the GPU code path. Consider different values of `parallel_iterations` on `dynamic_decode`.
